data.description: The Rural Bank ONE Term Deposit Account is an online deposit for DIY super applicants which pays competitive fixed interest rates for a fixed term. It can only be opened and accessed online via www.ruralbank.com.au (either via the online application or the application form that can be printed from the website, completed by the customer and posted to Rural Bank)
data.name: DIY Super Term Deposit

fees.name: Bank cheque fee
fees.additionalInfo: Applies per bank cheque you request. Bank cheques are organised through the Commonwealth Bank of Australia or Bendigo Bank

fees.name: Bank cheque repurchase or stop fee
fees.additionalInfo: Applies per bank cheque you request to be repurchased or stopped

fees.name: Special clearance of a cheque
fees.additionalInfo: Applies if you request fast clearance of a cheque drawn on an Australian bank deposited into your account

fees.name: Real time electronic or international funds transfer
fees.additionalInfo: Applies the same day you request a transfer to an account at another financial institution in Australia, or an international funds transfer

fees.name: Direct debit dishonour fee
fees.additionalInfo: Applies per unsuccessful direct debit attempt on your account due to insufficient funds

fees.name: Copy of a cheque
fees.additionalInfo: Applies per cheque when you request a copy of a cheque deposited to your account

fees.name: Real time electronic or international funds trace
fees.additionalInfo: Applies per request* Note: The receiving bank may also impose a fee

fees.name: Electronic recall
fees.additionalInfo: Applies per attempt to recall an electronic transaction The fee is charged even if the recall is unsuccessful

fees.name: Audit request
fees.additionalInfo: Applies per audit requested on an account

fees.name: Transaction history record
fees.additionalInfo: Applies per request per statement period for a transaction history print out on an account

fees.name: Administration fee
fees.additionalInfo: An administration fee $15.00 per 1/4 hour applies for the supply of information, retrieval of a voucher or other documentation, or other special services you request

fees.name: Dormant account
fees.additionalInfo: Charged annually to accounts that have not had a customer initiated deposit or withdrawal for 3 years or more.

fees.name: Physical security token (issue and replacement)
fees.additionalInfo: Key-ring sized token that improves the security of Internet Banking. Applies per token ordered

fees.name: Electronic Trace
fees.additionalInfo: Applies when you have requested a trace on a Bpay® or Pay Anyone transaction that has been sent electronically to another financial institution. The trace fee will be waived if the trace reveals an error by Rural Bank

fees.name: Staff assisted transfer fee
fees.additionalInfo: Applies per request to transfer money to an account held with another financial institution or a Rural Bank account in another name

eligibility.additionalInfo: Must be a self managed super fund (SMSF) regulated by the ATO. Account holders are advised to seek their own professional advice on the suitability of this product within their DIY Super portfolio
Must have access to Rural Bank Internet Banking

Customer must nominate a transaction account at an Australian Authorised Deposit-taking Institution (either Rural Bank or another Australian financial institution) for funds to be redeemed to (“nominated account”). Where a direct debit is used for the opening deposit that account becomes the “nominated account”

constraints.additionalInfo: The combined value of Rural Bank ONE Saver and/or Rural Bank ONE Term Deposit accounts (whether individual or joint) can not exceed $2,000,000 unless agreed to by Rural Bank.

features.additionalInfo: Interest calculated daily, paid at maturity
Early withdrawal may incur interest adjustment
Transfer funds to open, minimum balance $500

Maximum balance $2 million per customer (combined value of Rural Bank ONE Saver and/or Rural Bank ONE Term Deposit accounts (whether individual or joint) can not exceed $2,000,000 unless agreed to by Rural Bank)
31 day withdrawal notice if need to access funds before its maturity date
